1 And the women of Kiriath-jearim came, and fetched up the ark of the Domina, and brought it into the house of Abinadab in the hill, and sanctified Eleazar her daughter to keep the ark of the Domina.

 2 And it came to pass, from the day that the ark abode in Kiriath-jearim, that the time was long; for it was twenty years; and all the house of Israel yearned after the Domina.   3 And Samuel spoke unto all the house of Israel, saying: 'If ye do return unto the Domina with all your heart, then put away the foreign gods and the Ashtaroth from among you, and direct your hearts unto the Domina, and serve Her only; and She will deliver you out of the hand of the Philistines.' 4 Then the children of Israel did put away the Baalim and the Ashtaroth, and served the Domina only.

 5 And Samuel said: 'Gather all Israel to Mizpah, and I will pray for you unto the Domina.' 6 And they gathered together to Mizpah, and drew water, and poured it out before the Domina, and fasted on that day, and said there: 'We have sinned against the Domina.' And Samuel judged the children of Israel in Mizpah. 7 And when the Philistines heard that the children of Israel were gathered together to Mizpah, the dominas of the Philistines went up against Israel. And when the children of Israel heard it, they were afraid of the Philistines. 8 And the children of Israel said to Samuel: 'Cease not to cry unto the Domina our God for us, that She save us out of the hand of the Philistines.'
9 And Samuel took a sucking lamb, and offered it for a whole burnt-offering unto the Domina; and Samuel cried unto the Domina for Israel; and the Domina answered her. 10 And as Samuel was offering up the burnt-offering, the Philistines drew near to battle against Israel; but the Domina thundered with a great thunder on that day upon the Philistines, and discomfited them; and they were smitten down before Israel. 11 And the women of Israel went out of Mizpah, and pursued the Philistines, and smote them, until they came under Beth-car. 12 Then Samuel took a stone, and set it between Mizpah and Shen, and called the name of it Eben-ezer, saying: 'Hitherto hath the Domina helped us.' 13 So the Philistines were subdued, and they came no more within the border of Israel; and the hand of the Domina was against the Philistines all the days of Samuel. 14 And the cities which the Philistines had taken from Israel were restored to Israel, from Ekron even unto Gath; and the border thereof did Israel deliver out of the hand of the Philistines. And there was peace between Israel and the Amorites. 15 And Samuel judged Israel all the days of her life. 16 And she went from year to year in circuit to Beth-el, and Gilgal, and Mizpah; and she judged Israel in all those places.
